Reviews.Title: “Really basic and DIRTY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alberto T
Reviews.Content: Old Place, bad maintained, not clean, no lifts, really a bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: niall m
Reviews.Content: on first impression i was pleased with room, clean and nice. But at nine in the morning someone outside my window decided to fix the brick work with a hammer for over an hour and a half. I wanted a lie in but had to get up and leave the hotel as my head was begining to pound. When i left the room i realised you could hear the banging all over the hotel but no one had done anything about it. I complained at the reception but the staff reaction was pathetic they were completely gormless. I was going to put a good review on till this happened so i suppose you coulc have a good stay if you are lucky. But i would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff, Decent Hotel, Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravelChick1
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have a bit of a 'mixed bag' of reviews. My mom and I are travelling together this summer, and we decided to leave our visit with family a few days earlier than planned (as my stomach couldn't handle the one hour train ride from Surrey to London) so we wanted to find a reasonably priced hotel close to central London. I found the Elephant and Castle Eurotraveller online for 99 pounds/night. We stayed in room number 3, the ground floor which worried me at first as I thought that it would be noisy, but it wasn't a problem at all. A few times we heard people walking by (as we kept our window open), but no noise late at night. The bed was comfortable, as was the standing shower. The bathroom was quite a good size. The flat screen tv on the wall was in a great place as we could sit in bed and watch a bit of tv before falling asleep. Location, was only about five blocks from the Elephant and Castle Tube Station, however, if you have heavy suitcases like we do, I would suggest that you take a bus from another tube station to get to the hotel. E&C station was a huge pain to pull heavy suitcases up quite a few sets of stairs. The bus stops are only a half block up the street, and run very frequently so we ended up taking the bus more often than the tube! I'm not sure that my mom felt totally comfortable in the neighbourhood, but I felt fine there. As for staff service, it was fantastic! I'm surprised to read that others had such bad service as we had one guy (I feel bad as I don't know his name) bend over backwards for us when we first arrived. Our fan was making a weird noise so he went and got us a new one, and he grabbed us more towels and pillows. Whenever we wanted to know how to get somewhere, he would google it, and then print out the directions for us! We plan to stay here again at the end of August before we fly back home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: swimmingotta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurotraveller for a week while finalising moving our move to Australia. The room was fantastic, didn't really hear the busy road outside. The bed and bedding were of a good standard, the bathroom was very big and clean. We had the two of us, 5 suitcases and about 4 other smaller bags and still had loads of space, never feeling cramped. The staff at the desk were the one thing that let it down. Things were usually too much trouble and when you walked passed them to enter or leave the hotel it was like they were having a private joke about you. Would stay again though as the price and location were perfect. Brilliant place, out of the Congestion Zone for a car, but the £10 a night car park would be too rich for me. Good buses into London within about 7 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to iron out some issues but otherwise for the price you get an above average budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SpikeOwen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights June 27th and June 28th. Double room Number 4 on the ground floor. Both the bedroom and bathroom were clean and well kept and certainly ample in size. Nice TV located on the wall and a huge bonus was the quality of the fan (June 27th was a scorcher so it was most appreciated). Such a shame that the ceiling has two holes in it that have been crudely covered over with A4 pieces of paper! I note that an early review on another site has mentioned this as well, so clearly the owners are not particularly bothered about such tackiness. Worst thing, though, is that room 4 is right next to either an air conditioning motor or some sort of generator, the noise was constant, loud and made for a restless nights sleep. It's also worth mentioning that the ground floor rooms have windows that once open, can easily be accesed by the more determined snooper. Meaning that in the summer when you need them open, anyone can peer or reach in to your room. On the pus side the staff were always friendly. I feel I must defend the area since it's been called into question in many other reviews. This is South London, not Central London, as reflected in the price to stay in this hotel. Walworth, Kennington and Elephant & Castle surround the Euro Traveller, and all three areas are cosmopolitan but never threatening. The hotel is in between two main roads, Walworth Road and Kennington Park Road. We used the pubs on and around Kennington Park Road and had a lovely time. Kennington Tube Station is a 10 minute walk away and there's a ream of buses that stop on the road to take you all over the place. For breakfast at a reasonable price, there is the Amore cafe which is situated on the Walworth Road and is located right by the hotel.So need to pay the overpriced rate (Â£9) the hotel charges for what apparently is a less than fulfilling breakfast. It's a better than average budget hotel, one that just needs a bit more care and attention to things like safety, noise and asthetics. 3/5

Reviews.Title: “Black mold and pubic hair in the blocked up shower !!!”
Reviews.Author: sambirchy
Reviews.Content: You'd think my title would say it all !! , but you are wrong avoid the eurotraveller hotel in elephant and castle !!! , me and my friends were looking forward to a weekend away to watch glee at the O2. However despite being in a rough area, the hotel looked nice on the out side We were greeted by rude staff , we then entered the room, and my eye sight was assaulted by the cheap and distasteful decor, also I was taken aback by the fact that we had book three single beds and we were greeted by a single and double. However what had distracted us from the disappointment of the bed situation was the brutal assault on our sense of smell on entering the bathroom!!!!!!!!!!!!! We were privy to the gut wrenching smell of sewage, whilst I was bursting for the toilet I held my nose trying to thing of the weekend ahead, I noticed the shower had water pooling in it from a blocked plug , upon closer inspection there was a black mould like substance floating the water , as well as pubic hair . We had to rush out thinking we could sort this out later, we arrived back and complained , the night manager didn't believe us so he checked our room and agreed it shouldn't be like that , it took us 2 hours to get him to move us as he was offering to clean it up , and apparently the sister hotel on old Kent road was " Full" but this suggestion still rendered the shower useless and his only suggestion was wait for people to check out in the morning and use there shower. So in total we phoned approximately 30 hotels and hostels and all were full , as by magic all of a sudden a room was free at the eurotraveller on old Kent road , on transferring to that hotel at 01:30 in the morning paying for our own taxi , we eventually got to the new hotel and room , it was clear that this " cabin" was what the chain classed as a luxury room , and it became more apparent this was the reason we were told they were full due to the price difference of the rooms booked . Sorry that view was so long I felt its necessary for all the facts to be relayed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: americantraveller74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of a very diverse neighbourhood. It is quite modern, the rooms are spotlessly clean (and maintained as such) and rather large for a London hotel. The bathroom is very modern and also quite large for London.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this disgusting low rate so called hotel”
Reviews.Author: vince1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 25th & 26th Jan due to work commitments as it was close to the office. At 65.00 per night It was a total waste of time and money from start to finish. The first night I arrived very tired after working 14 hours and was due to start at 7.30am the next day so was looking forward to a good sleep. I asked for a quiet room at the back but instead got put in a room opposite 3 very loud drunken northern labourers who had bought women back picked up from the pub. If that wasn't bad enough the guy next door had a prostitute visiting so there was the noise from both sides. I was so tired and couldnt be bothered to move and got very little sleep. I complained the next morning and was moved to another room which was supposed to be better. I went to the office and worked late again and went back even more tired hoping to get a good rest but there were 2 drunk females in the room next door who were very loud till early hours of the morning dispite me banging on the wall to ask them to be quiet. If all that wasn't bad enough the fire alarm went off in the room at 6.30am I dressed and grabbed my stuff and went to reception only to be told that it went off due to someone having a hot shower in another room. I have complained about my stay but the hotel have done nothing at all. The next 4 days of work I stayed at the Brittania International at Canary Wharf and it was like another world with nice beds and peace and quiet. It was only 10.00 per night more than the Eurotraveller too

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: christie584
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in London, we had to take the longgg trip from the airport to a bus stop, then get a cab at about 3am to the hotel (our driver had never heard of the hotel!). When we got in, they were expecting us and we found a nice sized room with a flat screen tv - the best tv selection we'd found in Europe! There was a constant supply of shampoo and soap in the bathroom that they refilled daily and there was a coffee maker and tea in the bedroom. Although it wasn't the most desirable bathroom and shower, there are no real complaints. There was no breakfast at the hotel, but there are restaurants and McDonalds around the corner. The bus stop for a 24 hour bus was about 10 steps away and the ride into the city was about 10 minutes. I never like staying too far from the center but this was amazingly convenient (the bus routes are so easy to follow). When it was time to leave, we had nothing to access internet on, so the reception let us go behind the desk to look up bus times and called and arranged a cab for us to leave for the airport at 330am. We were very pleased with the service and the hotel overall. It was also the best value that we had in this expensive city. I'm not sure what other ppl were expecting when they gave bad reviews - if you want high class, dont go for budget prices!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, for London (South) it's great!”
Reviews.Author: Captaincy
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because it's walking distance to Ministry of Sound and a short cab ride to Mass in Brixton. Upon arrival we found the staff at the front desk to be *extremely helpful*, we got a room on the 2nd floor, but that was fine as the staff helped us with our bags. No lift at this hotel. In terms of the room appointment, it was compact and very clean. There was hot water on all the time in the shower and all the other facilities in the room were fine. I have noticed plenty of complaints on here, but I am a very picky person and found no reasons to moan. If we had any problems they were dealt with quickly and the front desk's staff were friendly, efficient and very professional. All in all, I'd suggest this place to anyone who wants a simple place to sleep. At the bottom of the road are some very good places to eat (Mama Thai is fantastic) and Elephant and Castle tube is only a five minute walk. It's South London and you feel like you are in the middle of the action. This was a great find. Oh, always book online for the best prices.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: MDW491
Reviews.Content: There's nothing to whine about with this Hotel, you get what you pay for. My partner, her son and myself stayed here from 30th Dec 08 - 1st Jan 09 for the New Year Fireworks on the South Bank. The Hotel is basic, but comfortable, nice friendly staff, we had a family room which was suitable for our needs, and I don't see the point in paying over the odds for what is more or less a shower and a sleep. The area is a little rough on the edges, but don't let that put you off, we didn't have any problems at all. The Elephant and Castle Tube Station is only 10 minutes walk away, and if you cross the road by the Library on Walworth Road, you don't need to go into the underpasses, which I'm warey of at the best of times. Overall a nice and clean Hotel, and we would stay here again if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent”
Reviews.Author: Bazx
Reviews.Content: The hotel all in all was OK, the room was clean but the shower was terrible it has go down as the smallest shower cubicle ever. However the hotel as I said is ok and for a cheap night close to London you can't complain. The staff seemed friendly enough and where helpful when we required assistant. However the area of Elephant & Castle is by no where near a place I would happily walk around of a night or of a day in fact. We used taxi to ship us to and from the hotel, one big tip don't use private hire cabs, there a rip off they make up the prices as they go along use black cabs so you can at least watch the meter. The hotel OK but the area is not. I won't ever go back in that hotel or area.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Dani1979
Reviews.Content: We came to London on a hen weekend and couldnt find somewhere to accomodate all of us so we came to our 3rd choice, the Eurotraveller, Amelia St. It turned out to have everything we needed, friendly staff, clean rooms, karaoke in the bar, a bus ride away from all the bars and clubs from west end and a fantastic breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP.”
Reviews.Author: Blue-Army-Bristol
Reviews.Content: We had paid for our stay by credit card via the internet. When we arrived at the 'hotel' I was given Paperwork to sign. I wasn't impressed when I saw my full credit card details, expiry date and my 3 digit code on the form. Then I was asked to sign below them. This I believe is unacceptable as fraudulent activities can occur, the credit card number should only show the last few digits! We quickly got ready and headed down to the bar, only to be told the bar is closed.......Permanently!! I asked why they advertise this facility on their website if it doesn't exist, the response I received was that they will eventually get around to changing it.....again, I didn't think this was acceptable. The continental Breakfast costs Â£8, but only consists of cornflakes & toast. Value for money....I think not. Possibly a safe hotel as it's opposite a police station, but you'll hear the squad cars leaving throughout the night, with their sirens blaring....peaceful, I think not. And finally, a great place if you're a train spotter.....you'll hear them passing throughout the night and morning, the railway line is metres away!! I will NEVER return.

Reviews.Title: “The second worst hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: RiverMonster
Reviews.Content: If you like a hotel where you can touch facing walls at the same time, experience the thrill of passing trains 30m from your window, hear conversations in a room two doors away, enjoy personal attention in a sad, underground breakfast room where you are the only person eating, and do your bit for the planet by using one tiny bar of soap for 3 days, then this is the place for you. (If you like all the above plus you have a penchant for mosquitos then I can recommend a hotel right next to the train station in Bordeaux.) Do not even think about taking your wife or girlfriend here unless you are looking for a way out of your relationship.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James2574
Reviews.Content: Modern Facilities such as wireless access to the internet, which was convient as I had bought my laptop. The staff were really friendly and provided recommendations for site seeing and travelling around the London. Central London was only a 10 minute bus ride or cab ride away too all the major attractions, such as the London eye, Oxford street, Houses of Parliament, etc... Rooms were nice, with full on-suite, Tv (sat/cable), tea and coffee making facilities and more. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Express by Eurotraveller Hotel and recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: HardtoTravelLight
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Eurotraveller for 3 reasons: 1) Wireless Internet 2) Price 3) Bathtub This place was a nightmare. The Eurotraveller is in the Elephant Castle neighborhood of London--it's a rough neighborhood but we were forewarned that it wasn't Kensington. There are no decent restaurants in the neighborhood --it's a rough area. The hotel is small, the rooms are very very small and the beds are so lumpy that the back pain was excruciating. We are talking 20 year old mattresses. The TV is a whopping 13 inch older unit. The bathroom cabinet was missing the doors. There is no closet or dresser. The walls are so thin you can hear snoring through them not to mention any other activities. If another room has their windows open and the people are talking they may as well be in your room--but don't count on them speaking English since it seems to be a favorite haunt for foreigners also seeking a bargain. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone ever. If you need WiFi, keep looking or settle for a better neighborhood (the Brewers Inn perhaps in Putney) that is sure to have Internet Cafe's closeby. We spent an agonizong four days there and regretted it from the moment we checked in. Unfortunately, with the cancellation policy of 72 hours, we were locked in and stuck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Eurotraveller Hotel - Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: J_O'neill
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was convenient, as it was close to the city. There were a number of buses running to and from the city + there is an underground station (5mins form the hotel). The room was, excellent, comfortable and had modern facilities such as on-suite, Tv (satalite & cable), wireless internet, tea/coffee facilities and more. The staff were friendly and were available 24hrs. Prices were excellent, Â£79 for a double room. There are a large number of restaurants and takeaways available nearby and a shopping areas. Overall I enjoyed my stay at Eurotraveller Hotel and will definitely be going back.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurotraveller Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 18 Amelia Street | Walworth, London SE17 3PY, England
